task.title: Processing topics with XSLT in preprocess
task.shortdesc: You can pass parameters from the Ant build to existing XSLT steps in both the pre-processing pipeline and certain DITA-OT transformations. This can be useful if you want to make the parameters available as global xsl:param values within XSLT overrides.

step.cmd: Create a plug-in descriptor file plugin.xml that imports a new Ant buildfile build.xml.

stepxmp.codeblock: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <?xml-model href="https://www.dita-ot.org/rng/plugin.rnc" type="application/relax-ng-compact-syntax"?> <plugin id="plugin-id"> <feature extension="ant.import" file="build.xml"/> <feature extension="depend.preprocess.post" value="target-name"/> </plugin>

step.cmd: Create Ant buildfile build.xml with a target to process all DITA topics in temporary directory.

stepxmp.codeblock: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <project> <target name="target-name"> <pipeline taskname="xslt"> <xslt basedir="${dita.temp.dir}" style="${dita.plugin.plugin-id.dir}/filter.xsl"> <ditafileset format="dita" processingRole="normal"/> </xslt> </pipeline> </target> </project>

step.cmd: Create XSLT stylesheet filter.xsl to filter topic content.

stepxmp.codeblock: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?> <xsl:stylesheet version="2.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform"> <xsl:template match="???"> <xsl:copy> <!--TODO: come up with some example processing --> <xsl:apply-templates select="@* | node()"/> </xsl:copy> <xsl:template> <xsl:template match="@* | node()"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:apply-templates select="@* | node()"/> </xsl:copy> <xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

taskbody.result: The filter.xsl stylesheet will transform every DITA topic after preprocessing.
